member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.ExtenderBase
member.summary: Base class for Infragistics.WebUI extenders.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.ExtenderBase.GetScriptDescriptors(System.Web.UI.Control)
member.summary: Generate the script descriptor.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.ExtenderBase.GetScriptReferences
member.summary: Generate the script references of scripts.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.ExtenderBase.GetExtenderScriptDescriptor(System.Web.UI.Control)
member.summary: Extended class may return ScriptBehaviorDescriptor for its script object.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.ExtenderBase.GetExtenderScriptReference
member.summary: Extended class may return ScriptReference for its script object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.ExtenderBase.TargetHtmlElementID
member.summary: The id of the target html element.
member.remarks: It can be an exact id of any html element or a formatter string for the ClientID of the TargetControl defined by TargetControlID. Example of a resizer for UltraWebTab: "{0}_cp".

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.ExtenderBase.Enabled
member.summary: Option to enable or disable this extender.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.ExtenderBase.StateValue
member.summary: Property which is updated by data from the client with the OnInit event.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.LocalizedCategoryAttribute.GetLocalizedString(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the localized category name.
member.param: Name of the category to retreive

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.WebResizingExtender
member.summary: Extender which can be attached to a target Control and provides ability to resize html element represented by that target.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebResizingExtender.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebResizingExtender.ToolTip
member.summary: Title for the html element which represents the handle of the resizing frame-element.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebResizingExtender.OnClientResize
member.summary: Client event fired after resizing. It can be canceled by args.set_cancel(true), where args is the second parameter in the handler function.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebResizingExtender.OnClientResizing
member.summary: Client event fired while resizing. It can be canceled by args.set_cancel(true), where args is the second parameter in the handler function.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebResizingExtender.OnClientMouseOver
member.summary: Client event fired when the mouse enters the bounds of the resizing handle.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebResizingExtender.OnClientMouseOut
member.summary: Client event fired when the mouse leaves the bounds of the resizing handle.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebResizingExtender.OnClientInitialize
member.summary: Client event fired after a javascript object was initialized.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebResizingExtender.HandleClass
member.summary: Name of the css class applied to the resizing handle.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebResizingExtender.HandleImage
member.summary: Name of the url applied to the src of the IMG element which represents the resizing handle.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebResizingExtender.ResizeOffsetLeft
member.summary: Offset in pixels of the left side of the resizing frame-element relative to the left side of the target element.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebResizingExtender.ResizeOffsetTop
member.summary: Offset in pixels of the top side of the resizing frame-element relative to the top side of the target element.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebResizingExtender.ResizeOffsetRight
member.summary: Offset in pixels of the right side of the resizing frame-element relative to the right side of the target element.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebResizingExtender.ResizeOffsetBottom
member.summary: Offset in pixels of the bottom side of the resizing frame-element relative to the bottom side of the target element.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebResizingExtender.MinimumWidth
member.summary: Minimum width of the target element.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebResizingExtender.MinimumHeight
member.summary: Minimum height of the target element.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebResizingExtender.MaximumWidth
member.summary: Maximum width of the target element.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebResizingExtender.MaximumHeight
member.summary: Maximum height of the target element.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebResizingExtender.ResizingParentType
member.summary: Approach to calculate the parent html element of the resizing frame-element. The resizing element can be inserted into the target html element directly or into the parent(s) of the target element.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebResizingExtender.ResizeBorderWidth
member.summary: Width of the border for the resizing frame-element.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebResizingExtender.ResizeBorderStyle
member.summary: Style of the border for the resizing frame-element.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebResizingExtender.ResizeBorderColor
member.summary: Color of the border for the resizing frame-element.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebResizingExtender.TargetWidth
member.summary: Width of the target html element in pixels.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebResizingExtender.TargetHeight
member.summary: Height of the target html element in pixels.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.ResizingParentType
member.summary: Enumerator for the ResizingParentType property of WebResizingExtender

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.ResizingParentType.Auto
member.summary: Parent html element for the resizing element is calculated automatically using the type of the target element.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.ResizingParentType.Embedded
member.summary: The resizing html element is embedded as a child into the target html element. Note: that will fail if the target does not allow any children. For example, INPUT.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.ResizingParentType.External
member.summary: The resizing html element is embedded as a child into the parent of the target html element.
